attributes.action: Allow gyms & leisure centres to reopen
attributes.additional_details:
Winter is approaching, which means seasonal depression for many. Surely that reason alone is suffice. 
Not to mention we are now being forced into yet another lockdown which could mean a rise in suicide rates and mental health problems.
attributes.background:
To get the government to rethink their decision on closing gyms and leisure centres. 
The government need to come to some agreement on reopening them, as myself and many other people rely on these facilities to improve mental health and well-being.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign some of these petitions:

Keep gyms and leisure facilities open during any lockdown: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/556956

Prevent gyms closing due to a spike in Covid 19 cases: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/333869

The Committee will be holding a debate on Covid-19 restrictions on gyms and sport on Monday 23 November. You will be able to watch the debate on Parliament TV at 4.30pm: https://www.parliamentlive.tv/Commons
